lines.text: People don't believe in god so much as they choose not to believe in nothing.
Why didn't you call and say you were alive?
I thought I was dead.
You told me I was going to be safe with you.
You're safe. You're safe because we died already.
[after Max crashes his car with Carla in it]
Just between us, what happened?
He was showing me something.
What, that brick walls are hard?
You think I'm a fraud.
It's been 3 months since the crash, and I haven't thought of you at all.
This is a German car?
Swedish!
It's very sturdy.

It's a very safe car - a very safe car, and I'm an excellent driver. I've never been in an accident - well at least not while behind the wheel. But even strapped in to all of this marvelous technology of the reenforced doors and roof - we could still get crushed.
She won't talk. Very Catholic. Old World, you know. Full of guilt, shame.
I'm full of guilt and shame. How is that Old World?
[to himself]
This is it. This is the moment of your death.

[comforting a child during plane crash]
Put you head down... it will be over soon. Now close your eyes... everything is wonderful.
People say they want to know the truth, but what they really want to know is that they already know the truth.
We have lived together for 16 years. They have been great.
Eh, not always.
Yes, always. They've always been great for me. Even when I hate you, I know I love you.

[talking to God]
You want to kill me but you can't!
Let's buy gifts for the dead!
He and your wife are the only survivors I can't reach. She won't talk and he won't admit the crash was bad.
Is that right? He says it was good?
Says it was the best thing that ever happened to him.
Did you hear that?
Max, this is a very important meeting. I need you to calm down. I need you to be with me. All right? God, you're such a neurotic.
[pause]
Something's not right.
[an explosion rocks the cabin, and the passengers scream]
Oh shit!

[over the P.A., frantically]
This is your Captain. Please return to your seats, put your tray tables up and fasten your seatbelts.
Ladies and gentlemen, please be sure to fasten your seatbelts tightly around your waist! The flight attendants will be coming by to collect all your trays!
[the cabin shakes heavily, bags drop from the overhead compartments]
Is everything okay?
We're just fine. We just hit a little unexpected turbulence.

[over the P.A., calmly]
This is your Captain speaking.
I don't think this is turbulence!
We're experiencing problems with our hydraulic system.
The hydraulics!
What?

[screaming]
He can't steer! We're going down!
[the plane starts spiraling down]
Mr. Klein, I'm Cindy Dickens of Intercity Air, and I'm here to help get you home.
Well that's nice, no one's taken me home since the 1st grade.
You can't save everybody, Max, you gotta try taking care of yourself.
Pray for us. This is the hour of our death.
So what are you saying? That there's no God, but there's you?
[repeated line]
I know, I'm terrible.

[as the airplane is about to crash]
Everything's okay.
[first lines]

[seeing more survivors]
Hey, there's more over here! Bring another team! Another team here by the tail! We're going to need a lot more help.
The United States is finished. But you and me, we're in peak condition.
